===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|かんてん|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR}}

===Etymology 1===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=かんてん}} compound {{m|zh|寒天|tr=han  then|lit=cold + heavens}}. Compare the modern {{etyl|hak|-}} ''hòn-thiên'' or {{etyl|nan|-}} ''kôaⁿ-thiⁿ''.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かんてん}}

# [[cold]] [[weather]]
# a [[wintry]] [[sky]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|寒空|さむぞら}}

===Etymology 2===
''Kanten'' was discovered in roughly 1658 by innkeeper {{lang|ja|美濃太郎左衛門}} (''Mino Tarōzaemon'') after discarding some {{m|ja|心太|tr=tokoroten||a kind of jelly-like noodle made from boiled seaweed extract}} outside, and noticing that it had gelled overnight in the winter weather and then dried to a white powder over the next few days. According to various sources, the substance was called {{lang|ja|寒天}} by taking the first and last elements of the phrase {{m|ja|寒}}{{m|ja|晒|晒(し)}}{{m|ja|心太}} ('''''kan'''-zarashi tokoro'''ten'''''), literally “cold-exposed tokoroten”.<ref>'''2014''', {{lang|ja|女性におすすめのダイエット食と健康食}} (''Josei ni Osusume no Daietto Shoku to Kenkō Shoku'', “Diet and Health Foods Recommended for Women”) (in Japanese), All About staff editors, [[w:Tokyo|Tōkyō]]: All About.<br/>Text may be viewable at Google Books [https://books.google.com/books?id=tzaEBQAAQBAJ&pg=PA4&dq=%E5%AF%92%E5%A4%A9%E3%81%AE%E7%99%BA%E8%A6%8B%E3%80%80%E7%BE%8E%E6%BF%83&hl=en&sa=X&ei=W3rpVInoD4zvoASu0ID4Dg&ved=0CCUQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=%E5%AF%92%E5%A4%A9%E3%81%AE%E7%99%BA%E8%A6%8B%E3%80%80%E7%BE%8E%E6%BF%83&f=false here].</ref><ref>'''2006''', {{lang|ja|日本料理事物起源}} (''Nihon Ryōri Jibutsu Kigen'', “The Origins of Japanese Cuisine Items”) (in Japanese), Kōzō Kawakami and Masahiro Koide, [[w:Tokyo|Tōkyō]]: [[w:Iwanami Shoten, Publishers|Iwanami Shoten]].<br/>A text snippet may be viewable at Google Books [https://books.google.com/books?id=SgNOAQAAIAAJ&q=%E5%AF%92%E5%A4%A9%E3%81%AE%E7%99%BA%E8%A6%8B%E3%80%80%E7%BE%8E%E6%BF%83&dq=%E5%AF%92%E5%A4%A9%E3%81%AE%E7%99%BA%E8%A6%8B%E3%80%80%E7%BE%8E%E6%BF%83&hl=en&sa=X&ei=W3rpVInoD4zvoASu0ID4Dg&ved=0CCwQ6AEwAg here].</ref>

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|寒天紙|かんてんがみ}}: a thin sheet of dried ''kanten'', used to add gloss to woven textiles and as decoration for women's braided hairstyles
* {{ja-r|寒天草|かんてんぐさ}}: alternate name for {{ja-r|天草|てんぐさ}}, a [[sea vegetable]] from which ''kanten'' is made
* {{ja-r|寒天織|かんてん しき}}: [[gelatinous]] [[connective tissue]], a type of connective tissue found in [[invertebrate]] animals and in the early stages of [[vertebrate]] animal development
* {{ja-r|寒天培養基|かんてん ばいようき}}: agar [[culture]] [[medium]]
* {{ja-r|寒天版|かんてんばん}}: an agar [[printing]] [[plate]] used for [[printmaking]], basically identical to a [[gelatin]] printing plate
{{der-bottom}}
